results.content_html: I was hoping more in-depth data modeling and real challenge. This was pretty basic course. Section 9 was something that I was looking for more.

results.content:
Very basic yet fundamental. Not a lot of practice, mostly examples. I recommend this course to those who are making their very first steps with SQL. Be aware that the content is heavily duplicated for 2 platforms: PostgreSQL and MS Server SQL so the total content of the course to actually learn is half of the hours than those in the description.
Pros:
1. The instructors are clear and succinct.
2. Good basic tips that will save you later on.
3. Real world databases to work with to get a solid impression.

Cons:
1. Does not cover what you need for an actual interview.
2. Imoprtant (NOT advanced) features of SQL like "Having", "In/Not in", Aggregation Functions, Triggers, Functions, Views and Security are not covered.
3. No real problems to solve, simple quizes with obvious answers so there is no real "doing".

The course is outdated, and the vary basics of the work environment are not explained, so you might encounter a lot of technical problems, but hey, that's just the way it is :).

Overall, the course is useful to get an overall picture of the subject.

results.content:
Good course in that it covers two SQL versions. But concepts are explained twice from the same script, so it's clear that this was meant to be two courses and they were combined without editing that would have added understanding.

Everything was well explained.
